title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 08 December 2011 - XWiki
content:

07:56 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:23 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:24 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: The App wizard is new in RC1?  
08:24 <@sdumitriu> XWIKI-7190  
08:24 <+mflorea> yes, some parts of it were available before, but the wizard is new is RC1  
08:25 <@sdumitriu> OK, so I'll put it in the release notes  
08:25 <+mflorea> (i.e. the class editor and the live table generator were available in 3.3M2, but used separately)  
08:25 <+mflorea> yep  
08:28 <@sdumitriu> It would be nice to check and expand the description after I save the initial version  
08:28 <+mflorea> sure  
08:34 <vmassol> good morning  
08:34 <vmassol> hmm I'm worried, my jetty instance is eating all my cpu this morning....  
08:35 <vmassol> 170%  
08:35 <vmassol> unfortunately I can't connect to it with a profiler since it's running in normal mode, too bad  
08:35 <vmassol> but it means something is amiss somewhere  
08:39 <vmassol> could be linked to the ircbot scheduler job somehow  
08:39 <vmassol> a sigquit revealed 3 threads executing the scheduler job at the same time  
08:40 <@sdumitriu> sburjan`: Can you fill in the list of supported browsers?  
08:44 <@sdumitriu> mflorea: Done, all yours  
08:44 <+mflorea> ok  
08:51 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:38 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <CIA-115> tmortagne master \* r87c16ce / pom.xml : Move to 3.4-SNAPSHOT - http://git.io/t-f-VA  
09:55 <vmassol> sdumitriu: seems there's a link issue  
09:55 <vmassol> the tweet links to http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/Blog/XWiki%20Enterprise%2033%20Release%20Candidate%201%20Released  
09:55 <vmassol> which is non-existent  
09:58 <vmassol> would be good to verify the link before tweeting, I think something similar happened during the last release. Maybe the script shouldn't automate this part?  
09:58 <vmassol> guys we need to improve http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise33RC1 it's really not nice looking  
09:59 <vmassol> and people are looking since the advertisement is out  
10:02 <vmassol> mflorea: can you add screenshots for App within minutes to the RN?  
10:02 <+mflorea> that's what I'm doing now ;)  
10:02 <vmassol> ok  
10:20 <+sburjan> vmassol: reproducing oracle issue on RC1 so I can have a solid affects field there :)  
10:20 <+sburjan> not on a snapshot  
10:20 <+sburjan> good morning btw :)

10:41 <vmassol> bb in 1 hour

11:33 <vmassol> mflorea: we need an extension on extensions.xwiki.org for app within minutes. You already have the screenshots ready for it :)  
11:33 <vmassol> (btw would be nice to show the appwithinminutes home page too in the screenshots)  
11:34 <+mflorea> ok, I'll add one, and I'll create the extension  
11:34 <vmassol> cool  
11:41 <+sburjan> we have the Portuese (Brasil) flag missing  
11:41 <+sburjan> :)  
11:42 <vmassol> maybe evalica can help  
11:44 <npm> has quit  
11:50 <vmassol> sburjan: how much have you tested the EM?  
11:51 <+sburjan> I only tested it before M2 .. when we discussed that search doesn't work  
11:51 <vmassol> for ex:  
11:51 <vmassol> \* multiwiki. Install in a given wiki  
11:51 <vmassol> \* upgrades  
11:51 <vmassol> \* extension with deps  
11:51 <vmassol> \* extension with incompatible deps compared to what is installed  
11:51 <vmassol> have you tested these?  
11:52 <+sburjan> no  
11:52 <vmassol> tmortagne: do we have automated tests for these?  
11:52 <vmassol> ok so we need to test it  
11:52 <+tmortagne> vmassol: back  
11:52 <+sburjan> I wil ltest it after I finish with oracle  
11:52 <+tmortagne> reading  
11:54 <+tmortagne> vmassol: there is no UI tests of the new UI AFAIK unless sdumitriu currently working on it but there is plenty of unit tests on all that and adding more everydays  
11:54 <+tmortagne> there is a lot of both REST and UI tests on on XR  
11:55 <vmassol> ok so ATM we still need to do some manual tests till sdumitriu fixes existing tests and till we beef them up  
11:55 <+tmortagne> yep  
11:56 <vmassol> I'm going to try adding a dependency on one extension on extensions.xwiki.org to verify that works  
11:58 <vmassol> xwiki;org is really slow btw  
12:00 <jvdrean> has quit  
12:01 <vmassol> mflorea: is this an app?  
12:01 <vmassol> because if it is then our current naming scheme is to suffix with "Application"  
12:02 <vmassol> (we need to define this more precisely btw - I have a mail that I'm preparing on this)  
12:14 <npm> has joined #xwiki  
12:22 <rrodriguez> has joined #xwiki  
12:41 <npm> has quit  
12:43 <vmassol> tmortagne/sdumitriu: what's the point of the "repository" field displayed when clicking on "Details" for an extension in the EM UI?  
12:43 <vmassol> right now it points to a REST resource and I don't think that's very useful for the casual user  
12:44 <vmassol> tmortagne: it's really really slow to click on "details" btw  
12:45 <+tmortagne> vmassol: that's where the extension has been found (which repository), it should probably just display the id and not be a link  
12:46 <vmassol> a link to the repo is ok  
12:46 <vmassol> but not a rest link  
12:46 <vmassol> I don't know if you have that metadata though ATM  
12:46 <+tmortagne> vmassol: don't know what to tell you about speed, on java side EM fill the whole Extension object using only one request it should be pretty quick  
12:46 <vmassol> (the repo home url)  
12:47 <+tmortagne> the repo is a rest  
12:47 <+tmortagne> from EM point of view  
12:47 <vmassol> sure but it could have a URL,  
12:47 <vmassol> a link to describe it basically  
12:47 <vmassol> (human readable link I mean)  
12:48 <+tmortagne> a description then that coul also contain a link yes  
12:48 <+tmortagne> right now it only have required technical information  
12:48 <vmassol> yes it could be done with a descirption although it's less semantic  
12:48 <vmassol> ok  
12:49 <+tmortagne> planned to add more thing when providing UI to add more repository  
12:49 <+tmortagne> right now it's only from configuration  
12:49 <vmassol> right now the repo id is not really very useful indeed  
12:49 <vmassol> a link to the extenson would be more useulf  
12:49 <vmassol> this is the main thing missing IMO  
12:49 <+tmortagne> the id is not here for the user as I said there is only technical information that's all  
12:50 <+tmortagne> I don't undertand what you mean  
12:50 <+tmortagne> there is a link to the extensioin  
12:50 <vmassol> where?  
12:50 <+tmortagne> well I seen it yesterday just after the link to the repo  
12:50 <vmassol> this is what I see:  
12:50 <vmassol> https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/gqsa6/xwiki-preferences-xwiki.xwikipreferences-xwiki  
12:50 <+tmortagne> di you clicked on details ?  
12:51 <vmassol> ofc  
12:51 <+tmortagne> hmm that's weird I had way more thing yesterday under description  
12:51 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-7251  
12:51 <+tmortagne> and there was another tab  
12:51 <+tmortagne> let me re-chec locally  
12:52 <vmassol> I've rebuilt XE from master 1 hour ago  
12:58 <+tmortagne> will a bit a time actually since master moved to 3.4-SNAPSHOT, it's currently redownloading everything  
13:00 <mflorea> has quit  
13:00 <+tmortagne> hmm sdumitriu forgot yo update the version on https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/master/pom.xml  
13:00 <+tmortagne> makes pretty much everything trigger 3.3-SNAPSHOT  
13:01 <+tmortagne> fixed, rebuilding again  
13:01 <CIA-115> Thomas Mortagne master \* rd51868c / pom.xml : Update version after branch creation - http://git.io/pczFwA  
13:06 <+tmortagne> vmassol: I think I know, I probably forgot to update xwiki.org after http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-7233  
13:07 <+tmortagne> so the client display URL but only if ha have it and since I was testing with a local repository that's why I seen it  
13:07 <vmassol> so the UI would only display it if it receives it?  
13:07 <vmassol> ok  
13:07 <+tmortagne> you can try putting an explicit URL in the object editor if you want to do a quick test I think  
13:07 <+tmortagne> finishing building and I will update xwiki.org  
13:08 <vmassol> k I can wait  
13:08 <vmassol> btw  
13:08 <vmassol> on my screenshot  
13:08 <vmassol> do you know why for the first extension, there's no repository field displayed?  
13:09 <+tmortagne> yep seen it too but I don't understand no  
13:10 <+tmortagne> does this extension have something special ? installed one or something ?  
13:11 <+tmortagne> no sure if this UI is supposed to display anything else that remote extensions, what I can tell you is that it's imposisble to have an Extension object without a repository, event if not a remote one it would have the local or core repository  
13:12 <+tmortagne> but was thinking mayb sdumitriu only display repository for remote extensions  
13:14 <vmassol> it's not special  
13:14 <vmassol> not installed and coming from extensions.xwiki.org  
13:16 <+tmortagne> ok then no idea, probably a bug  
13:16 <+tmortagne> [restarting xwiki.org]  
13:18 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
13:20 <+tmortagne> vmassol: do you get the link in detail now ?  
13:20 <vmassol> checking  
13:21 <vmassol> yes for some  
13:21 <vmassol> https://skitch.com/e-vmassol/gqsh5/xwiki-preferences-xwiki.xwikipreferences-xwiki  
13:21 <vmassol> strange that it's not for all  
13:22 <vmassol> also I don't think it's a good idea to have extensions.xwiki.org as the label  
13:22 <vmassol> it's misleading  
13:22 <vmassol> I thought it was a link to the repository  
13:22 <vmassol> and not a link to the extension documentation  
13:27 <+tmortagne> there should not be any label IMO  
13:27 <+tmortagne> directly click on "Website" or something  
13:27 <+tmortagne> or an icon  
13:27 <vmassol> yes  
13:27 <+tmortagne> like a planet  
13:28 <vmassol> I've updated XWIKI-7251  
13:28 <+tmortagne> ok  
13:28 <vmassol> bot bot… come on….  
13:28 <vmassol> seems it's on strike  
13:28 <+tmortagne> ha sorry forgot again  
13:28 <vmassol> must be a French bot  
13:28 <vmassol> :)  
13:28 <vmassol> nope it's automatic ow  
13:28 <vmassol> :)  
13:28 <vmassol> oh I know why  
13:28 <+tmortagne> ha right  
13:29 <vmassol> I noticed an issue yesterday  
13:29 <vmassol> it starts the bot  
13:29 <vmassol> but didn't start the botlets  
13:29 <vmassol> don't know why yet  
13:37 <vmassol> ok I can reproduce locally. I'll debug  
13:38 <vmassol> ok I know  
13:38 <vmassol> same reason as beofre: getRenderedContent() issue

14:11 <+sburjan> guys, you should also update the download page.. it still has M2 as the latest  
14:13 <+sburjan> is it normal to get a lot of infos in the console on the new RC1 ? I get a lot of stuff regarding cache. but I mean .. a lot  
14:14 <+sburjan> on each page reload actually  
14:24 <+sburjan> ok, I only get this on Oracle, maybe it's a logging leftover  
14:45 <+Enygma`> I also get stuff like: ISPN000156: You are not starting all your caches at the same time.  
14:45 <+Enygma`> which I thought was supposed to be fixed by Thomas some time ago  
14:46 <+Enygma`> I get that just at startup though  
14:47 <+sburjan> maybe it's something oracle related  
14:47 <+sburjan> anyway.. back to work

17:41 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping

17:51 <sburjan> has quit  
18:05 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong  
18:05 <@sdumitriu> Yeah, I fell asleep, only a few steps left to do  
18:05 <vmassol> sdumitriu: still I think the script is not correect  
18:05 <vmassol> it shouldn't send a tweet before the version has been released  
18:06 <@sdumitriu> Yes, I need to update the download page update script  
18:06 <vmassol> you mean it ran before the tweet but failed "silently"?  
18:06 <@sdumitriu> Yes  
18:07 <vmassol> I see  
18:07 <@sdumitriu> It still updates the previous download page  
18:11 <CIA-115> Vincent Massol stable-3.3.x \* racbf7b0 / (6 files): XWIKI-7255: Botlets are not started automatically when the IRC Bot Scheduler job starts the Bot - http://git.io/b2doXQ  
18:12 <vmassol> sdumitriu: the blog post is missing too. I put a redirect for the time being to avoid a page not found  
18:12 <vmassol> (since the link was given in the tweet)  
18:13 <vmassol> sdumitriu: why do we keep 3.1.x on the download page and branch? shouldn't we remove them?  
18:14 <vmassol> (it should have been removed when we started 3.3M1 normally actually)  
18:15 <vmassol> sdumitriu: do you need help to create jobs for 3.3 on http://ci.xwiki.org/view/Commons/  
18:15 <vmassol> (or is that automated?)  
18:17 <@sdumitriu> Enygma`: Can you check the XEM release notes?  
18:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: title isn't correct  
18:17 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: The blogpost should be there, checking...  
18:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: couldn't find it this morning  
18:19 <vmassol> Enygma`: on http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXEM33RC1 we need to explain and point to some doc to explain how to create a farm now  
18:19 <vmassol> Enygma`: is manager.xwiki.org up to date?  
18:22 <@sdumitriu> Indeed, the blog post isn't there, I wonder what happened...  
18:36 <+Enygma`> sdumitriu:  checking  
18:37 <+Enygma`> vmassol: nothing`s changed re creating farms  
18:37 <vmassol> Enygma`: errr?  
18:37 <vmassol> if I want to create a farm I won't install XEM  
18:38 <vmassol> its not for creating farms  
18:38 <vmassol> anymore  
18:38 <vmassol> why would I want the workspaces feature if my use case is to cretae a farm  
18:38 <vmassol> like for xwikiorg or myxwiki.org  
18:38 <vmassol> ?  
18:38 <vmassol> again they're separate use cases  
18:39 <+Enygma`> right, now I understand what you mean  
18:39 <vmassol> this was in the vote email  
18:39 <vmassol> ok  
18:39 <vmassol> :)  
18:42 <+sburjan`> vmassol: IMHO we should list the downloads in a DESC order. latest Milertorne, RC and only after the latest stable final release. Everybody does it this way  
18:42 <vmassol> I agree  
18:42 <vmassol> sdumitriu: wdyt?  
18:43 <vmassol> we want people to try the latest  
18:43 <vmassol> to provide feedback  
18:43 <+sburjan`> yepp.  
18:47 <@sdumitriu> OK

20:32 <vmassol> you need verbatim
